pages.title: The Broadcaster
pages.text: The Broadcaster is a block version of the Transmitter that allows you to play the MIDI File from an inserted Floppy Disk.$(br2)To use a Broadcaster craft one, place it into the world, and then right click on it to open the Broadcaster Screen.

pages.title: Broadcaster Screen
pages.text: The Broadcaster Screen works in the exact same way as the $(l:5_5transmitter#screen)Transmitter Screen$(), except that inserted Floppy Disks automatically start playing when they are inserted (like a Minecraft Jukebox).

pages.title: Redstone Output
pages.text: The Broadcaster block will output a a Redstone signal on all sides when a valid Floppy Disk is loaded and is either Playing or Paused.$(br2)If no Disk is present, an error occurs while loading the Disk, playback is stopped, or the song ends then the Broadcaster will not output any Redstone signal.

pages.title: Automation
pages.text: If you place a hopper below the Broadcaster it will remove the Floppy Disk that it has unless it is outputting a Redstone signal, which locks the Hopper.$(br2)If you place a Hopper so that it points into the Broadcaster a new Floppy Disk can be inserted when the Broadcaster is empty which it will automatically start playing.

pages.title: Unloading
pages.text: If the Chunk containing a Broadcaster is unloaded, because no players are near it, the Broadcaster will automatically stop playing the Floppy Disk that it contains and reset its playback position to the beginning.$(br2)When the Chunk is loaded again the Broadcaster will automatically start playing the Floppy Disk that it contains.
